intro: Brachynema ornans, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer. Its leaves are succulent and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Brachynema ornans is well adapted to hot, dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
